newsitem.title: POLAND: Poland to float three distillers - paper.
newsitem.headline: Poland to float three distillers - paper.

text.p: The Polish treasury ministry plans to seek a listing for the three largest state owned distilleries on the Warsaw bourse, a ministry official told the Dziennik Prawa i Gospodarki daily.

"We're talking about Polmos Poznan, Zielona Gora and maybe Bialystock," a high ministry official, who the paper did not name, said in Wednesday's edition, referring to the cities where the firms are based.
No one at the ministry was immediately available for comment.
The paper said some ministry officials wanted state-owned distilleries transferred to an industrial investment fund yet to be formed. @
It said Treasury Minister Miroslaw Pietrewicz would make the final decision on the method of privatisation in the next few weeks.

Investors would be invited to bid for medium-sized Polmos firms, the paper said, adding that Polmos Poznan, Zielona Gora and Bialystock made net profits of 57 million zlotys, 20.6 million zlotys and 11.1 million zlotys respectively last year.
